# Task

Write a pig latin transformer called `pig_latinify` that operates on a vector of strings. It iterates over each string and changes it to pig latin. Each iteration should run on a separate thread.



# Data

pig_latinify(["hello", "apple", "strong", "world"])

```julia
using LinearAlgebra

function pig_latinify(strings::AbstractString))
    # Function to convert words to pig Latin
    functions = [
        function(string) -> string .replace("a","e").replace("e","i").replace("i","y").replace("y","a"), end,
        function(string) -> string .replace("o","u").replace("u","iu").replace("iu","ou").replace("ou","ao"), end,
        function(string) -> string .replace("b","d").replace("d","p").replace("p","b"), end,
        function(string) -> string .replace("c","k").replace("k","c"), end
    ]

    # Iterate over each word in the input strings
    for i = 1:length(strings)
        # Split the word into its individual letters and store them in a character vector
        words = split(strings[i]], " ")
        # Iterate over each letter in the individual letters of the current word
        for j = 1:length(words[j]])
            # Convert the individual letter to its Pig Latin equivalent and append it to the end of the current individual letter
            pig_latin_letter = tolower(words[j]][words[j]].[1]).replace("a","e").replace("e","i").replace("i","y").replace("y","a"), end
            # Append the end of the current individual letter to the end of the previous individual letter in the current word
            words[j]] .= pig_latin_letter end
        end
        # Convert the resulting character vector back into a single string and append it to the end of the input strings
        final_string = join(words, " ")) append_strings(strings) end

# Return the resulting Pig Latin transformed string
return final_string
end
